Operation 'WarmUpIp' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Current description is too brief and lacks critical details. Missing: what input is required (IP address), what the operation does (gradually increases volume per schedule), what is returned (warmup status object), and side effects (IP enters warmup mode with send limits). Enhanced description provides AI agents with complete context for when and how to use this operation.

data.current_summary: Start warming up an IP address
data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to put an IP address into warmup mode.**
data.description_suggestion: Initiates automated IP warmup for a dedicated IP address. Requires the IP address as input. Once activated, SendGrid will gradually increase email send volume according to the predetermined warmup schedule, limiting hourly send rates based on warmup duration. Returns the warmup status object with current progress. The IP address will remain in warmup mode until explicitly removed.
data.reasoning: Current description is too brief and lacks critical details. Missing: what input is required (IP address), what the operation does (gradually increases volume per schedule), what is returned (warmup status object), and side effects (IP enters warmup mode with send limits). Enhanced description provides AI agents with complete context for when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'ListWarmUpIp' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details. Summary is clear and actionable, but description lacks output details. Missing: what data structure is returned (array of objects), what fields are included (progress, limits, completion estimate), and use case context. Enhanced description helps AI agents understand the response format and when to use this operation.

data.current_summary: Retrieve all IPs currently in warmup
data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve all of your IP addresses that are currently warming up.**
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a list of all dedicated IP addresses currently in warmup mode. Returns an array of warmup status objects for each IP, including current warmup progress, hourly send limits, and estimated completion. No input parameters required. Use this to monitor the status of multiple IPs undergoing automated warmup.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and actionable, but description lacks output details. Missing: what data structure is returned (array of objects), what fields are included (progress, limits, completion estimate), and use case context. Enhanced description helps AI agents understand the response format and when to use this operation.

message: Operation 'GetWarmUpIp' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_context. Summary is clear, but description lacks output details and has formatting issues. Missing: what specific data is returned (progress percentage, limits, dates), parameter requirements, and guidance on when to use this vs. the list endpoint. Enhanced description provides complete information for AI agent decision-making and includes cross-reference context.

data.current_summary: Retrieve the warmup status for a specific IP address
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve the warmup status for a specific IP address.**

You can retrieve all of your warming IPs using the "Retrieve all IPs currently in warmup" endpoint.
- Tags: IP Warmup
- Response Schemas: 200
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed warmup status for a specific IP address. Requires the IP address as a path parameter. Returns a warmup status object containing current warmup progress (percentage complete), hourly send limit, estimated completion time, and warmup start date. Use this endpoint to check individual IP warmup progress before making sending decisions. For monitoring multiple IPs, use the list endpoint instead.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear, but description lacks output details and has formatting issues. Missing: what specific data is returned (progress percentage, limits, dates), parameter requirements, and guidance on when to use this vs. the list endpoint. Enhanced description provides complete information for AI agent decision-making and includes cross-reference context.

message: Operation 'StopIpWarmUp' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is clear and actionable, but description has formatting errors and lacks critical side effects information. Missing: parameter requirements (IP address), consequences of the action (full capacity sending, reputation impact), and irreversibility context. Enhanced description clarifies the destructive nature of this operation and provides guidance for AI agents to make informed decisions.

data.current_summary: Stop warming up an IP address
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to remove an IP address from warmup mode.**

Your request will return a 204 status code if the specified IP was successfully removed from warmup mode. To retrieve details of the IP's warmup status *before* removing it from warmup mode, call the  "Retrieve the warmpup status for a specific IP address" endpoint.
- Tags: IP Warmup
data.description_suggestion: Removes a dedicated IP address from warmup mode. Requires the IP address as a path parameter. Returns a 204 No Content status on successful removal. Once removed, the IP will no longer have hourly send limits and can send at full capacity. Important: Verify the IP's warmup progress using the get endpoint before stopping warmup, as premature removal may impact sender reputation. This action cannot be undone without restarting warmup.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and actionable, but description has formatting errors and lacks critical side effects information. Missing: parameter requirements (IP address), consequences of the action (full capacity sending, reputation impact), and irreversibility context. Enhanced description clarifies the destructive nature of this operation and provides guidance for AI agents to make informed decisions.
